text.more:
What is this?

This is an computer generated atlas of Youtube

  • Each bubble is a Youtube channel.
  • Each line represents the overlap of commenters between two channels. All lines indicate an overlap of at least 350 commenters.
  • The colors represent communities of densly connected channels found using modularity analysis.
  • The layout of the map was constructed using the Fruchterman-Reingold algorithm.


Website Controls

  • Left click and drag to pan.
  • Scroll to zoom or use the zoom buttons at the bottom of the screen.
  • Click on a channel to filter the atlas to only that channel's connections.
  • Use the search bar to locate a specific channel and filter the atlas to that channel's connections.
  • The number of channel names shown can be adjusted using the slider on the main panel.
  • Click the info icon in the bottom left to bring up this help panel.


I have not done much web development like this so please be patient as I learn what works and what doesn't. Mobile viewing is currently not supported.

This project was made with SigmaJS and Gephi. My code is available here.
